intro: Spatalla abietina, commonly known as the mountain heather, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats. Spatalla abietina is known for its resilience to cold temperatures and its ability to bloom even in harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of alpine ecosystems.
